title: Why are space rocks not considered planets? - Quora

response.answer_text: International astronomical union made a definition for a planet8in 2006.So there are only 8 planets in the solar system’ is in orbit around the Sun,has sufficient mass to assume hydrostatic equilibrium (a nearly round shape), andhas "cleared the neighborhood" around its orbit. Here condition 2 is the reason.for not including space rocks.wikipedia.

Since you do not know the definition of what makes a planet, this question seems logical to you. It is not. Please look up the definition of a planet, then decide if you can edit this question to fit, or just pop it in the round file. No offense.
